name: Contemporary Agricultural Systems  Credit
description: Course Description: Designed to bring together students from across the college in a singular course to become more agriculturally literate individuals and develop a sense of connection to the College of Agricultural Sciences and within the agricultural industry. Goals are achieved through quality field experience engagement, frequent reflection, and small group discussions centered around the depth and breadth of the diverse system of agriculture.
column11: Restrictions: Must not be a: Junior, Senior. Must be a: Undergraduate.
column12: Registration Information: Required field trips. Credit not allowed for both AGRI 100 and AGRI 181A1.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Plants and Civilizations (GT-SS3)
description: Course Description: Plant origins and their relationships with cultures/civilizations as food, spices, perfumes, and medicines and in art, religion, wars, slavery, etc.
column10: Additional Information:  Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion 1C, Human Behavior, Culture, or Social Frameworks (GT-SS3).
column11: Also Offered As:  IE 116.
column12: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and recitation. Credit not allowed for both AGRI 116 and IE 116.

name: Orientation to Agricultural Systems  Credit
description: Course Description: Freshman inquiry course in agriculture. Information and skills necessary to succeed in majors in the agricultural sciences.

name: World Interdependence-Population and Food (GT-SS3)
description: Course Description: Survey of world population and food; emphasis on understanding the problems and opportunities in a world context.
column10: Additional Information:  Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion 1C, Human Behavior, Culture, or Social Frameworks (GT-SS3).
column11: Also Offered As:  IE 270.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AGRI 270 and IE 270.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Transfer Seminar  Credit
description: Course Description: The university and its resources, college success skills, careers in the various disciplines of agriculture; current issues in agriculture.
column11: Registration Information: Intended for Transfer students.

name: Issues in Agriculture
description: Course Description: Scientific, technical, cultural, and social issues facing agriculture, and their interrelationships.
gradeMode: Grade Modes:  S/U within Student Option, Trad within Student Option.
column11: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AGRI 300 and AGRI 500. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Agricultural and Food System Ethics
description: Course Description: Basic concepts in ethics and their application to agriculture and the food system.
column11: Also Offered As:  PHIL 330.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AGRI 330 and PHIL 330.Term Offered: Spring.

name: U.S. Travel-Integrated Resource Management
description: Course Description: Evaluation of integrated ranch management decision alternatives in conjunction with professional resource managers.
column11: Also Offered As:  NR 383.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AGRI 383 and NR 383. Must register for laboratory and recitation. Required field trips.Term Offered: Spring.

name: A  Group Study: General
description: Course Description:

name: B  Group Study: Agricultural Ambassadors
description: Course Description:

name: Advanced Issues in Agriculture
description: Course Description: Scientific, technical, cultural, and social issues facing agriculture, and their interrelationships.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and recitation. Sections may be offered: Online. Credit not allowed for both AGRI 300 and AGRI 500.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Sustainable Agriculture
description: Course Description: An interdisciplinary study comparing conventional and alternative land management practices, using an agroecosystem analysis approach.
column11: Registration Information: Enrollment in INTO Master of Agriculture Pathways or graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: A  Study Abroad
credits: Field Applications in Sustainable Agriculture  Credit
description: Course Description: Travel to Todos Santos, Mexico for a seven day experience where in-the-field laboratory skills in sustainable agriculture are practiced. Investigate and implement unique, real-time initiatives developed in class while in Todos Santos.
column11: Registration Information: A minimum of a 2.5 GPA. This is a partial semester course.

name: Urban Horticulture
description: Course Description: Investigate and evaluate the techniques of incorporating food production systems in the urban and peri-urban environment.
column11: Also Offered As:  HORT 515.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AGRI 515 and HORT 515. Offered as an online course only.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Emerging Issues and Challenges for Global Agr
description: Course Description: Interdisciplinary course containing tools and knowledge to discuss the emerging challenges of the global agriculture, water, and food system.
column11: Registration Information: Written consent of instructor. Offered as an online course only.

name: Plant Tissue Culture
description: Course Description: Theory, technology, and techniques of cell, organ, tissue, and protoplast culture of plants.

name: Principles of Cooperative Extension
description: Course Description: Traditional and contemporary delivery systems of Cooperative Extension emphasizing structures of nonformal education.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Delivery of Cooperative Extension Programs
description: Course Description: Methods, techniques, and procedures in planning, implementation, and delivery of Cooperative Extension programs.
column11: Registration Information: Written consent of instructor.  Must register for lecture and recitation. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Capacity Building for a Changing Workplace
description: Course Description: A framework for competence in workplaces applies situation analysis/problem-solving to solve real-life agricultural situations shared by experts.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing in agricultural sciences. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Sociology of Food Systems and Agriculture
description: Course Description: How agricultural choices generate intended and unintended consequences for human communities and the natural environment.
column11: Also Offered As:  SOC 562.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AGRI 562 and SOC 562.

name: Issues in Animal Agriculture
description: Course Description: Issues that have a major impact on the direction of changes in animal agriculture.
column11: Also Offered As:  VS 570.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AGRI 570 and VS 570.Term Offered: Fall (even years).

name: Livestock-Wildlife Conflict & Law
description: Course Description: Investigation of the laws and policies surrounding livestock wildlife interaction and conflict at the federal, state, and international levels.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AGRI 300 or AGRI 500 or AREC 342 or AREC 375 or NR 320 or NR 425 or POLS 361.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Offered as an online course only. Credit not allowed for both AGRI 575 and AGRI 581A2.Term Offered: Fall.

description: Course Description:
column11: Registration Information: Written consent of instructor. Maximum of 12 credits allowed for AGRI 587A-B. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: B  Internship: International
description: Course Description:
column11: Registration Information: Written consent of instructor. Maximum of 12 credits allowed for AGRI 587A-B. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Bioenergy Policy, Economics, and Assessment
description: Course Description: Bioenergy policy; economic principles applied to biofuel production; evaluation of environmental impacts on bioenergy production.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AGRI 601 or ENGR 601. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Integrated Decision Making/Management Skills
description: Course Description: Motivation for management, decision making, introduction to systems, information management, introduction to statistics.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Building the Business
description: Course Description: Skills required to organize and implement a modern business enterprise with focus on land-based operations.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Managing for Ecosystem Sustainability
description: Course Description: Impacts of ecological processes, use of mechanism-based understanding, and tools used to manage the ecosystem for sustainability.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Understanding and Managing Animal Resources
description: Course Description: Evaluating nutritional requirements of a variety of animals, how and why requirements vary according to level of production.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Animal Production Systems
description: Course Description: Developing animal management systems for a variety of animal species in a forage-based environment.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Integrated Forage Management
description: Course Description: Development of management plans that integrate diverse forage resources including native rangeland and cultivated forages.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Required field trips. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Analyzing and Managing the Business
description: Course Description: Assimilating, preparing, and analyzing records; reading financial statements to manage a land-based business.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Understanding Policy and Emerging Issues
description: Course Description: Origination, purpose, and policy effects on land-based enterprises; policy effects on management decisions.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Ecosystem Services on Agricultural Lands
description: Course Description: Applies an economic lens to look at buying and selling ecosystem services. Learn about ecosystem services, but focus on how farmers, ranchers, and other extensive land users can profit from resources on agricultural properties. Examples include hunting and agro-tourism. Dig deeper to find other potential ecosystem services. Create an ecosystem marketing plan on an actual farm, ranch or other appropriate properties.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AGRI 630. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Offered as an online course only.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Products to Profit
description: Course Description: Marketing all aspects of the enterprise, beginning with land and forage resource and tracking all revenue generation.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Integrated Resource Management Plan
description: Course Description: Formulation of an optimal land management plan for a specific site based on specific goals and objectives.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.
